Not a bad start that. To convert to a '60 interior you would need to:

- Build a slanted sink unit to replace the (not pictured) cooker unit
- Stick some folding doors in place of the sliding wardrobe door
- Add an early cooker cupboard to the rear cargo door

And if you were really going for it then:

- Rebuild the rear seat back to include the sliding compartments
- Build some rear drawers to incorporate the sliding compartments mentioned above
- Swap the rear overhead lockers for the earlier side-shelves

Although most people would never notice or bother to replicate these last three I'd guess.

I was talking with an owner (can't remember his name) at Stanford Hall on Sunday, who had a really nice 15 window left hand drive, that had a Devon interior fitted. He had purchased a right hand drive interior and converted it himself, doing a fantastic job at it. Talking it through with him it's a fair amount of work, but if you've got the skills or can get someone to do it, it's worth the effort.
